sentences.en: attempts to prevent cancer cell proliferation
sentences.cn: 防止癌细胞扩散的努力

sentences.en: Embryos grow by cell division (= the splitting of cells ) .
sentences.cn: 胚胎通过细胞分裂而成长。

sentences.en: Guards rushed into his cell and strung him up.
sentences.cn: 狱吏冲进牢房把他吊死了。

sentences.en: He is cooped up in a cramped cell with 10 other inmates.
sentences.cn: 他和其他10名犯人被囚禁在一间狭窄的牢房里。

sentences.en: He was left to sober up in a police cell.
sentences.cn: 他被留在一间拘留室里醒酒。

sentences.en: One prisoner claimed he'd been dragged to a cell, stripped and beaten.
sentences.cn: 一名犯人声称他曾被拖进一间牢房，全身被脱光并遭到毒打。

sentences.en: That's better. I was suffocating in that cell of a room.
sentences.cn: 这样好些了，我刚才在那个小房间里快闷死了。

sentences.en: The prisoner started to wash down the walls of his cell.
sentences.cn: 囚犯开始冲洗各自囚室的墙壁。

sentences.en: The prisoners overpowered their guards and locked them in a cell.
sentences.cn: 囚犯们制服了监狱看守，并将他们锁进了牢房。

sentences.en: The smell in the cell was revolting.
They beat them up and locked them in a cell.
sentences.cn: 他们殴打了他们，并把他们锁在一间囚室里。

sentences.en: They threw him in a cell and roughed him up a bit.
sentences.cn: 他们把他扔进牢房，揍了他几下。

sentences.en: Vitamin B assists in red-blood-cell regeneration.
sentences.cn: 维生素B可以促进红细胞再生。

sentences.en: We were sitting together in our cell, chained to the wall.
sentences.cn: 我们一起坐在牢里，手被铐在墙上。

words.tran_cn: 细胞性；多孔性；细胞结构

phrases.tran_cn: 红血球（等于erythrocyte，red blood corpuscle或red cell，略作RBC）
鳞状细胞癌，扁平上皮癌
[医]淋巴细胞（胸腺依赖性细胞）

trans.tran_cn: 细胞，牢房，基层组织，小隔室，电池
trans.tran_en: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently
